Our messenger Mr. Dumysen rode to Bern last Monday; other places of the Confederates are also coming there, to ask Bern, if the Savoyard desires the right with Geneva, that they do not reject it. The Lord of Cr√ºtz, the king's legate in Solothurn, sent a note to the innkeeper at the Stork, written in French: the king was camped with over 40,000 strong at Havel de Gras, offered the English 4 tons of gold, that they refused; therefore the French seriously engaged with shooting and laid down the 2 best towers and prepared eagerly for the main assault.
There they did not trust the situation and surrendered, as their lives were spared and they were let go, and the king had the port back in.
Many thousands of the English fell out, and about 2400 honest people perished and were stabbed.
